articles.author: Bernard Orr
articles.description: After sealing pledges of a new era of strategic partnership with China's Xi Jinping, Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday is set to highlight the growing importance of trade near the Russian border in China's northeast.
articles.title: Putin to push growing Moscow-Beijing trade in China's northeast

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israel's tanks pushed into the heart of Jabalia in northern Gaza on Thursday, facing anti-tank rockets and mortar bombs from militants concentrated there, while in the south, its forces pounded Rafah without advancing, Palestinian residents and militants said.
articles.title: Israel moves in on north Gaza Hamas stronghold, pounds Rafah without advancing

articles.author: Patricia Zengerle
articles.description: The Republican-led U.S. House of Representatives passed a bill on Thursday that would force President Joe Biden to send weapons to Israel, seeking to rebuke the Democrat for delaying bomb shipments as he urges Israel to do more to protect civilians during its war with Hamas.
articles.title: US House votes to force weapons shipments to Israel, rebuking Biden

articles.author: Jackie Gu, Yimou Lee
articles.description: About a month before Taiwan's January presidential election, China began sending intruders over the Taiwan Strait: more than 100 balloons, some of which passed through the island's airspace or busy, Taipei-controlled air corridors for civil aviation.
articles.title: Tracking China's 'grey zone' balloon flights over Taiwan

articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Camille Raynaud
articles.description: French police reinforcements have started arriving in New Caledonia as part of a massive operation to regain control of the capital Noumea, the top French official in the Pacific island territory said on Friday.
articles.title: 'Massive' French police deployment arrives to secure New Caledonia

articles.author: Francesco Guarascio, Khanh Vu
articles.description: Vietnam forfeited at least $2.5 billion in foreign aid over the last three years and may lose another $1 billion because of administrative paralysis, the United Nations, the World Bank and Western donors told the government in a letter seen by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Vietnam forfeits billions of dollars in foreign aid amid anti-graft freeze, document says

articles.author: Yuliia Dysa, Anastasiia Malenko, Tom Balmforth
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy visited the northeastern city of Kharkiv on Thursday to boost morale and reinforce Ukraine's troops in the region where Russian forces are trying to press their new offensive beyond the border areas.
articles.title: Zelenskiy visits embattled Kharkiv region as Russian pressure mounts in east

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A severe storm packing hurricane-force winds pummeled Houston on Thursday, killing at least four people, blowing windows out of high-rise buildings and leaving some 800,000 homes without power as much of the city was plunged into darkness, the mayor said.
articles.title: Four deaths confirmed from severe storm that ravaged Houston

articles.author: Ayhan Uyanik, Boldizsar Gyori
articles.description: Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico was in "very serious" but stable condition on Thursday, a hospital official said, after he was shot five times in an assassination attempt that laid bare deep political divisions in the country.
articles.title: Slovak leader Fico stable after surgery but condition 'very serious'

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese commercial space company CAS Space announced its "space tourism vehicle" will first fly in 2027 and travel to the edge of space in 2028, state media reported on Friday.
articles.title: Chinese state-backed company to launch space tourism flights by 2028
